item.title: Jared add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He never went out without a book under his arm, and he often came back with two." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Jared add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "You cannot run away from a weakness, you must sometimes fight it out or perish. And if that be so, why not now and where you stand?" -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Jared add a quote by Augustine of Hippo
item.description: "Though good and bad men suffer alike, we must not suppose that there is no difference between the men themselves, because there is no difference in what they both suffer. For even in the likeness of the sufferings, there remains an unlikeness in the sufferers; and though exposed to the same anguish, virtue and vice are not the same thing. For as the same fire causes gold to glow brightly, and chaff to smoke; and under the same flail the straw is beaten small, while the grain is cleansed; and as the lees are not mixed with the oil, though squeezed out of the vat by the same pressure, so the same violence of affliction proves, purges, clarifies the good, but damns, ruins, exterminates the wicked." -- Augustine of Hippo

item.title: Jared add a quote by St. Augustine of Hippo
item.description: "Humility must accompany all our actions, must be with us everywhere; for as soon as we glory in our good works they are of no further value to our advancement in virtue. " -- St. Augustine of Hippo

item.title: Jared add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Only great pain, the long, slow pain that takes its time... compels us to descend to our ultimate depths... I doubt that such pain makes us "better"; but I know it makes us more profound... In the end, lest what is most important remain unsaid: from such abysses, from such severe sickness, one returns newborn, having shed one's skin... with merrier senses, with a second dangerous innocence in joy, more childlike and yet a hundred times subtler than one has ever been before." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Jared add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "To acquire the habit of reading is to construct for yourself a refuge from almost all the miseries of life." -- W. Somerset Maugham
